snippet: Notable changes include new spending for homeless shelters, millions more to offset pension fund underperformance and a reduction in projected tax revenues....
abstract: Administration of New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio announces that city will spend over $1.3 billion more than it had originally forecast in current budget; annual November financial plan update also highlights increased spending on homeless shelters, money set aside to offset pension fund underperformance, and savings from city agencies.
lead_paragraph: Notable changes include new spending for homeless shelters, millions more to offset pension fund underperformance and a reduction in projected tax revenues.

headline.main: Mayor de Blasio Increases New York’s Budget by $1.3 Billion
headline.print_headline: City’s Budget  Is Increased by $1.3 Billion
